quote: That brain of mine is something more than merely mortal; as time will show.
note: The mind has limitless potential that often goes unnoticed in the moment. With time, ideas and innovations that seem far beyond their era can eventually change the course of history.
In a world filled with complexity, true brilliance often lies in the ability to strip away the unnecessary. The simplest solutions are often the most profound and lasting.

quote: Do I contradict myself? Very well, then I contradict myself, I am large, I contain multitudes.
note: Human beings are inherently complex, full of contradictions that reflect our ever-changing nature. Embracing these contradictions can lead to a richer, more authentic experience of life.

quote: The greatest way to live with honor in this world is to be what we pretend to be.
note: Living authentically is the truest form of honor. When our actions align with our values, we no longer need to pretend or wear masks to gain approval from others.

quote: Keep death before your eyes each day and you'll never have a base thought or excessive desire.
note: Contemplating mortality helps us remain focused on what truly matters. By keeping the impermanence of life in mind, we are reminded to live with intention, clarity, and without attachment to fleeting desires.
